org.hps.monitoring.application

Class EventProcessing

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.hps.monitoring.application.EventProcessing

  • final class EventProcessing
extends Object
    This class encapsulates all of the logic involved with processing events and managing the related state and objects within the monitoring application.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  EventProcessing.SessionState
      This class organizes and encapsulates most of the objects used by an event processing session.
      private class  EventProcessing.SessionWatchdogThread
      This class will cause the application to disconnect from the current event processing session if the event processing thread completes.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private MonitoringApplication application
      Reference to the current application.
      private ConfigurationModel configurationModel
      Reference to the global configuration model.
      private ConnectionStatusModel connectionModel
      Reference to the global connection model.
      private ErrorHandler errorHandler
      The error handler, which is just a reference to the application's error handler.
      private Logger logger
      The logger to use for message which is the application's logger.
      private EventProcessing.SessionState sessionState
      The current EventProcessing.SessionState object which has all of the session state for event processing.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EventProcessing(MonitoringApplication application, List<CompositeRecordProcessor> processors, List<Driver> drivers, List<ConditionsListener> conditionsListeners)
      Class constructor, which will initialize with reference to the current monitoring application and lists of extra processors to add to the loop, as well as supplemental conditions listeners that activate when the conditions change.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void closeEtConnection()
      Close the current ET connection.
      (package private) void connect()
      Connect to the ET system using the current connection settings.
      private void createEtConnection()
      Create a connection to an ET system using current parameters from the GUI.
      private LCSimEventBuilder createEventBuilder(ConfigurationModel configurationModel)
      Create the event builder for converting EVIO events to LCSim.
      (package private) static int[] createSelectArray()
      Create the select array from event selection in ET stations (not currently used).
      (package private) void disconnect()
      Disconnect from the current session, closing the ET connection if necessary.
      (package private) void invalidate()
      Invalidate all of the local variables and session state so that this object is not usable after a disconnect.
      (package private) boolean isActive()
      Return true if the event processing thread is valid (non-null) and active.
      (package private) void killWatchdogThread()
      Interrupt and join the processing watchdog thread.
      (package private) void next()
      Get the next event from the loop if in pause mode.
      (package private) void pause()
      Notify the loop to pause the event processing.
      (package private) void resume()
      Resume processing events from pause mode by resuming loop event processing.
      (package private) void setup(ConfigurationModel configurationModel)
      Setup this class from the global org.hps.monitoring.model.ConfigurationModel object.
      private void setupLcsim(ConfigurationModel configurationModel)
      Setup LCSim event processing from the global org.hps.monitoring.model.ConfigurationModel object.
      private void setupLoop(ConfigurationModel configurationModel)
      Setup the CompositeLoop from the global org.hps.monitoring.model.ConfigurationModel object.
      private void setupSteeringFile(String steering)
      Setup XML steering from a file from disk.
      private void setupSteeringResource(String resource)
      Setup XML steering from a jar resource.
      (package private) void start()
      Start event processing on a separate thread and also start the watchdog thread.
      (package private) void stop()
      Stop the current session, which will bring down the current ET client connection and activate end-of-job and end-of-run hooks on all registered event processors.
      private boolean usingEtServer()
      Return true if using an ET server.
      private void wakeUpEtStations()
      Wake up all ET stations associated with the event processing.

    • Constructor Detail

      • EventProcessing

        EventProcessing(MonitoringApplication application,
                List<CompositeRecordProcessor> processors,
                List<Driver> drivers,
                List<ConditionsListener> conditionsListeners)
        Class constructor, which will initialize with reference to the current monitoring application and lists of extra processors to add to the loop, as well as supplemental conditions listeners that activate when the conditions change.
        Parameters:
        application - the current monitoring application object
        processors - a list of processors to add after configuration is performed
        drivers - a list of extra Driver objects to add to the loop
        conditionsListeners - a list of extra ConditionsListener to add to the loop

    • Method Detail

      • createSelectArray

        static int[] createSelectArray()
        Create the select array from event selection in ET stations (not currently used).
        Returns:
        The select array.

      • closeEtConnection

        private void closeEtConnection()
        Close the current ET connection.

        This method does not need to be synchronized, because it is only called from the disconnect() method which is itself synchronized.

      • connect

        void connect()
      throws IOException
        Connect to the ET system using the current connection settings.
        Throws:
        IOException - if any error occurs while creating the ET connection

      • createEtConnection

        private void createEtConnection()
        Create a connection to an ET system using current parameters from the GUI.

        This method does not need to be synchronized, because it is only called from the connect() method which is itself synchronized.

      • createEventBuilder

        private LCSimEventBuilder createEventBuilder(ConfigurationModel configurationModel)
        Create the event builder for converting EVIO events to LCSim.
        Parameters:
        configurationModel - the current global org.hps.monitoring.application.ConfigurationModel object

      • disconnect

        void disconnect()
        Disconnect from the current session, closing the ET connection if necessary.

      • invalidate

        void invalidate()
        Invalidate all of the local variables and session state so that this object is not usable after a disconnect.

      • isActive

        boolean isActive()
        Return true if the event processing thread is valid (non-null) and active.
        Returns:
        true if event processing thread is active

      • killWatchdogThread

        void killWatchdogThread()
        Interrupt and join the processing watchdog thread.

        This will happen if there is a user requested disconnect from pushing the button in the GUI.

      • next

        void next()
        Get the next event from the loop if in pause mode.

      • pause

        void pause()
        Notify the loop to pause the event processing.

      • resume

        void resume()
        Resume processing events from pause mode by resuming loop event processing.

      • setup

        void setup(ConfigurationModel configurationModel)
        Setup this class from the global org.hps.monitoring.model.ConfigurationModel object.
        Parameters:
        configurationModel - the global @link org.hps.monitoring.model.ConfigurationModel} object

      • setupLcsim

        private void setupLcsim(ConfigurationModel configurationModel)
        Setup LCSim event processing from the global org.hps.monitoring.model.ConfigurationModel object.
        Parameters:
        configurationModel - the global @link org.hps.monitoring.model.ConfigurationModel} object

      • setupLoop

        private void setupLoop(ConfigurationModel configurationModel)
        Setup the CompositeLoop from the global org.hps.monitoring.model.ConfigurationModel object.
        Parameters:
        configurationModel - the global org.hps.monitoring.model.ConfigurationModel object

      • setupSteeringFile

        private void setupSteeringFile(String steering)
        Setup XML steering from a file from disk.
        Parameters:
        steering - the steering file path

      • setupSteeringResource

        private void setupSteeringResource(String resource)
                            throws IOException
        Setup XML steering from a jar resource.
        Parameters:
        steering - the steering resource
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem accessing or setting up the resource

      • start

        void start()
        Start event processing on a separate thread and also start the watchdog thread.

        This method is called externally by the app to activate event processing after it is initialized and configured.

      • stop

        void stop()
        Stop the current session, which will bring down the current ET client connection and activate end-of-job and end-of-run hooks on all registered event processors.

        This method is called externally by the app to stop an event processing session e.g. from action event handling.

      • usingEtServer

        private boolean usingEtServer()
        Return true if using an ET server.
        Returns:
        true if using an ET server in the current session

      • wakeUpEtStations

        private void wakeUpEtStations()
        Wake up all ET stations associated with the event processing.
